an5.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an5.1:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an5.1:5.1: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a trainee.
an5.1:5.3: The powers of faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
an5.1:5.4: These are the five powers of a trainee.
an5.1:6.1: So you should train like this:
an5.1:6.2: ‘We will have the trainee’s powers of faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.’
an5.1:6.4: This is what the Buddha said.
an5.1:6.5: Uplifted, the mendicants approved of what the Buddha said.
